Herbal Tea and Honey Remedy: Create a blend of herbs like ginger, peppermint, and eucalyptus, which have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties. Mix with honey to soothe a sore throat and add a touch of sweetness. Drink warm or cold, depending on preference.

Saltwater Gargle: Salt has antibacterial properties that can help reduce swelling in the throat and fight off infection. Mix 1/4 teaspoon of salt with 8 ounces of warm water and gargle several times a day. Spit out after each gargle.

Steam Inhalation: Fill a bowl with hot water and add a few drops of eucalyptus oil or menthol. Cover head with a towel and inhale the steam for 5-10 minutes. The warmth and aroma can help loosen mucus and ease congestion.
Ginger and Lemon Juice Tonic: Grate fresh ginger and mix with lemon juice to create a soothing tonic. Drink a few sips every few hours to help reduce inflammation and boost the immune system.
Aromatherapy: Inhale the aroma of essential oils like lavender, peppermint, or eucalyptus to help relax and open up airways. Add a few drops to a diffuser or inhale directly from a cloth or tissue.
